Article.Abstract: The three-dimensional structure of a bacterial superantigen, Staphylococcus aureus enterotoxin H (SEH), bound to human major histocompatibility complex (MHC) class II (HLA-DR1) has been determined by X-ray crystallography to 2.6 A resolution (1HXY). The superantigen binds on top of HLA-DR1 in a completely different way from earlier co-crystallized superantigens from S.aureus. SEH interacts with high affinity through a zinc ion with the beta1 chain of HLA-DR1 and also with the peptide presented by HLA-DR1. The structure suggests that all superantigens interacting with MHC class II in a zinc-dependent manner present the superantigen in a common way. This suggests a new model for ternary complex formation with the T-cell receptor (TCR), in which a contact between the TCR and the MHC class II is unlikely.
Article.ArticleTitle: Crystal structure of a superantigen bound to MHC class II displays zinc and peptide dependence.
Article.Affiliations: Molecular Biophysics, Centre for Chemistry and Chemical Engineering, Lund University, PO Box 124, S-221 00 Lund, Sweden.
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Binding Sites; Cloning, Molecular; Crystallography, X-Ray(methods); Enterotoxins(chemistry; immunology); HLA-DR1 Antigen(chemistry); Humans; Models, Molecular; Molecular Sequence Data; Protein Conformation; Protein Structure, Secondary; Protein Structure, Tertiary; Recombinant Proteins(chemistry; immunology); Sequence Alignment; Sequence Homology, Amino Acid; Staphylococcus aureus; Superantigens(chemistry; immunology); Zinc(chemistry); Zinc Fingers

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The crystal structure contains the MHC/epitope complex bound to the superantigen (SAG) staphylococcal enterotoxin type H (SEH). SAG PDB chain is D. Residues that had a well ordered electron density and were included in the final model are: MHC chain α (PDB chain A) residues 3-182; MHC chain β (PDB chain B) residues 3-103, 112-190; epitope (PDB chain C) residues 306-318; SAG (PDB chain D) residues 2-213.

ThreeDimensionalStructureOfComplex.Comments: [| P-2: P306; P-1: K307; P1: Y308; P2: V309; P3: K310; P4: Q311; P5: N312; P6: T313; P7: L314; P8: K315; P9: L316; P10: A317; P11: T318; |] The SAG molecule binds to the b1 helix of the MHC molecule. It also makes van der Waal's interactions with the main chain of the N-terminal part of the epitope, from residue P-1: K307 to P3: K310. The SAG molecule actually covers almost half of the epitope-binding groove on the MHC molecule. Only minor conformational changes were observed on the MHC molecule and the epitope, upon binding of the SAG molecule to the MHC/epitope complex in comparison with HLA-DR1-HA-peptide complex [PDB: 1DLH]. The only important changes are located at the side chains of MHC residues A: E55, Q57; that are repositioned in order to be able to make van der Waal’s contacts with the SAG molecule.
